title: Dynamical Systems and Active Inference
description: Mathematical treatment of dynamical systems theory and its application to Active Inference modeling.
learning_objectives: Understand dynamical systems in Active Inference
Apply to neural and cognitive systems

content.overview: Dynamical systems theory provides the mathematical foundation for understanding how Active Inference systems evolve over time. It describes the behavior of complex systems, their stability properties, and how they respond to perturbations.

continuous_dynamical_systems.autonomous_systems: dx/dt = f(x) - evolution depends only on current state
continuous_dynamical_systems.stability: Linear stability analysis using Jacobian matrix

stability_theory.linear_systems: Stability determined by eigenvalues of system matrix

bifurcation_theory.saddle_node_bifurcation: Creation or destruction of equilibrium points
bifurcation_theory.period_doubling: Route to chaos through period doubling

attractor_landscape.basins_of_attraction: Sets of initial conditions that converge to attractor

examples.name: Neural Dynamics
examples.interpretation: Neural firing rates as dynamical system

examples.name: Belief Dynamics
examples.description: How beliefs evolve in Active Inference
examples.equation: dμ/dt = -∇_μ F(μ) - gradient flow on free energy

stochastic_dynamical_systems.stationary_distribution: π(x) ∝ exp(-2U(x)/σ²) where U is potential

chaos_and_complexity.lyapunov_exponent: Rate of divergence in chaotic systems
chaos_and_complexity.predictability_horizon: Time beyond which prediction becomes impossible

control_of_dynamical_systems.controllability: Can system reach any state from any initial condition?
control_of_dynamical_systems.observability: Can system state be determined from observations?
control_of_dynamical_systems.stabilization: Design control to stabilize unstable equilibria
control_of_dynamical_systems.optimal_control: Minimize cost while achieving control objectives

interactive_exercises.description: Analyze stability and bifurcations of dynamical system
interactive_exercises.task: Find equilibria, analyze stability, identify bifurcations
Design stabilizing control using Active Inference

common_misconceptions.clarification: Stochastic dynamical systems are common and important
Chaotic systems are deterministic but unpredictable
Stable systems can have complex dynamics (limit cycles, chaos)

further_reading.title: Dynamical Systems in Neuroscience
further_reading.author: Eugene Izhikevich
further_reading.description: Dynamical systems approach to neural modeling
